User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:34.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/34.0
Build ID: 20141126041045

Steps to reproduce:

Went to this web site:
The actual URL: http://harimaga.blogspot.com/ 
Its 'convenience' URL is:
http://blog.ahangama.com/
If you check the source code, you will see the following line in it that makes the alias URL:
<link href='http://blog.ahangama.com/' rel='canonical'/>
(See: http://googlewebmastercentral.blogspot.com/2009/02/specify-your-canonical.html)

Also please notice that the font is called with this CSS rule:
@font-face{font-family:samagana;
src:url(http://ahangama.com/woff/samagana.woff) format("woff");}


Actual results:

Firefox does not show the font that showed well all this while since 2009. This happened soon after I updated the font. None of the other browsers have this problem. I tested this in Windows 7, XP and Puppy Linux. The problem is isolated to Firefox only.


Expected results:

The web page (a blog at blogspot.com) should show the text in the hosted web font. I tested the font for errors. Also tested the .htacess file. It has the correct directive that is working properly on another web font server. (smartfonts.net)

I think that FF expects the URL for the font to be a relative address because the domain of the blog and the web font appear to be the same. A complication is that the blog's real domain is blogspot.com though its alias or 'canonical' URL is from ahangama.com.

I cannot change the CSS of the blog right now because Google seems to have withdrawn that facility. Besides, that could break proper display by all other browsers.

My humble suggestion is for Firefox to go by the IP address than the name of the domains when deciding if a web font is legitimately hosted.

Thanks.

JC
PS: The web font attached

Please see the following table for results for the font from some environs
=============================================================================
WEB SITE ->     ahangama.com	lovatasinhala.com   harimaga.blogspot.com
FONT SERVER     smartfonts.net (BOTH SITES)----->|  ahangama.com

                Does the browser show the font?
Safari          yes             yes                 yes
Chrome          yes             Yes                 yes
IE              yes             yes                 yes
Opera           yes             yes                 yes
Android browser yes             yes                 yes
Firefox (Win)   yes             yes                 no        <-- FIREFOX
FF in in Linux  yes             yes                 no        <-- FIREFOX
FF in Android   yes             yes                 no        <-- FIREFOX
==================================================================




The .htaccee file in both ahangama.com and smartfonts.net
=====================================================
AddDefaultCharset utf-8

AddType text/html .htm
AddType text/html .php
AddType application/x-woff .woff
AddType font/truetype .ttf
AddType application/javascript .js
AddType image/vnd.microsoft.icon .ico
AddType text/cache-manifest .manifest
AddType text/css .css

<FilesMatch "\.woff$">
  Header set Access-Control-Allow-Origin "*"
</FilesMatch>

SetOutputFilter DEFLATE
AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain image/vnd.microsoft.icon
=====================================================


Thank you.

JC

comments.raw_text:
The fix I suggested in the original report perhaps may be added to or replaced by the following:

Expand the hosting URL to the full address. Then test whether it belongs to the home domain of the web page trying to use the font. If not, read the .htaccess file if it allows the font to be used by outside domains.

Thank you.
